list_definition.definition: to move (one’s feet) along the ground etc without lifting them

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The old man shuffled along the street.
It’s your turn to shuffle (the cards).
He gave the cards a shuffle.

list_ex_of_english: Progressive whist is considered to be a game of chance, presumably largely because the partners are shuffled as well as the cards.
They had a colleague on each side of them supporting them as they shuffled their way to work, unable to walk of their own accord.
The modest church was packed (the tickets were free) with every agegroup - from those new to life to those on their way out - with concomitant gurgles and shuffles.
Today the figures are just shuffled out in percentages.
The contents of the package of cuts have been shuffled and the wrapping changed, but much of the destruction remains.
The pack has been shuffled so often that it is sometimes difficult to keep track of where the cards have immediately fallen.
Under these conditions, it could also be that more variability originally existed at the three distal loci but was selectively lost after it was shuffled by such recombination events.
The content of each row is maintained and the order within the row is shuffled.
